Well, I mean like he laid off with like going down on me and stuff like that, like when I went there UI dinner [cell phone rings] Hey dad, daddy I'm still at work, I gotta call you when I get home, ok, all right, ok, bye bye. Um, okay where was I?

DETECTIVE: After the New Years

//Oh yea, after the New Year,

//He wouldn't go down on you anymore

//After the New Year, not that he wouldn't but like he just didn't, like I didn't get like nothing significant happened with us. He didn't UI it was just like it was back in the beginning, like really mild.

DETECTIVE 2: Did he know you turned eighteen at that point?

He was jumping for joy.

DETECTIVE 2: When you turned eighteen. So there was no doubt in your mind he knew how old you were when you were originally UI

//He bought my - oh a hundred percent!
My Christmas no not my Christmas gift my birthday gift for being eighteen was a plane ticket to New York City. Like I left at 4:30 in the morning on my eighteenth birthday to go to New York to to be with him. And, I mean he didn't tell me he, I didn't know. He had a chauffeur pick me up from the airport um in a bullet proof black Mercedes, I remember that specifically. I've got pictures of that too if y'all want some pictures [giggles] but um, uh, whatchamacallit. Yeah I didn't know that he wasn't going to be there until after the chauffeur picked me up and said Jeffrey's on the phone for you and he handed me a phone. And then I spoke to Jeffrey, Jeffrey's like I'm not gonna be able to be there but I set all this stuff up for you, you're going to have a great time. Like you know then I just that was that, I got someone to stay with and um

//Was he ever into the S&M type of thing?

I don't even know what that is. Are you talking about whips and chains and stuff?

DETECTIVE: Right, the tying up, the
